figgy.title: I would like support added for ingesting mp3s directly into Figgy

comments.body: The alternative would be converting the MP3 source files to WAV for ingest. But since we added support for ingesting JPEG and PNG, supporting MP3 seems more consistent.

figgy.title: Pass parent object for CDL readability check for MVW child works
MVW CDL items are not viewable to some who have checked them out in the online catalog
Trentonian resource raises SystemStackError: stack level too deep when generating manifest

comments.body: This was a side effect of the Trentonian having FileSets and ScannedResources, so it was generating an 88k page manifest. We removed the directly attached filesets, so I'm closing this.
...What? Sorry, I'm confused. So you want to search for the ARK of a child record in Figgy and have the parent record return?

@tpendragon This is one of a handful of SC collections that have item-level metadata, including ARKs, in PUDL because that's the way they were ingested in PUDL. But there aren't components or item-level metadata for each photo in the finding aid.

So the compromise for getting these migrated to Figgy is to create a MVW linked to each finding aid component (representing all photos of a building), with child volumes for each photo, which allows us to:

1. Have a single object linked to the finding aid component, and embed the viewer in Pulfa/Pulfalight
2. Attach the item-level metadata to the child volumes (where it's accessible in the metadata drawer in the viewer)

The main outstanding issue is a navigation problem. Each photo has an ARK that currently points at PUDL. We can update those ARKs to go to the finding aid, but there are dozens or hundreds of photos for some buildings. But if you have a citation including the ARK, how would you know which photo it was referring to? We'd like some way for a user who lands at the finding aid component to navigate to the right photo.
Oh. So a link which navigates to the page in pulfa and the viewer loads the right item? There's a IIIF working group for this, but also an existing solution in UV I think. Would take some fiddling.

marc_liberation.title: reindex single record: call_number_browse and call_number_display
Reindex a bib Record - Implement Alma functionality for bibliographic#update

comments.body:
Below are a few screenshots showing that fields adds to enrich the records during the Publishing job. To get the current fields login to Alma and go to Resources + Publishing Profiles + select "General Publishing via FTP" + "Edit".

![alma_enrich_1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/568286/106510274-b50aed00-649c-11eb-9471-3d2e095dff08.png)

![alma_enrich_2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/568286/106510286-b89e7400-649c-11eb-81e2-364495119f5d.png)

![alma_enrich_3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/568286/106510292-bb996480-649c-11eb-8054-596141e8a383.png)

![alma_enrich_4](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/568286/106510305-bf2ceb80-649c-11eb-8e08-9aa3758e1406.png)

It seems that I can indeed click on the fields on the Schema and browse through the fields. I thought I couldn't (?)

But I also noticed that the Solr log is showing up and error on some of the fields defined in `solrconfig.xml`. The error says:

```
2/1/2021, 2:35:17 PM | ERROR true | x:marc-liberation-core-development | RequestHandlerBase | 
org.apache.solr.common.SolrException:  org.apache.solr.search.SyntaxError: 
Cannot parse  'cataloged_tdt:[NOW/DAY-7DAYS NOW/DAY+1DAY]': Encountered "  <RANGE_GOOP> "NOW/DAY+1DAY "" at line 1,​ column 29.

org.apache.solr.common.SolrException: org.apache.solr.search.SyntaxError: 
Cannot parse 'cataloged_tdt:[NOW/DAY-7DAYS NOW/DAY+1DAY]': Encountered " <RANGE_GOOP> "NOW/DAY+1DAY "" at line 1, column 29. 

Was expecting:     "TO" ...      	at 

org.apache.solr.handler.component.QueryComponent.prepare(QueryComponent.java:218) 	at 
...
java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Caused by: org.apache.solr.search.SyntaxError: 
Cannot parse 'cataloged_tdt:[NOW/DAY-7DAYS NOW/DAY+1DAY]': Encountered " <RANGE_GOOP> "NOW/DAY+1DAY "" at line 1, column 29.
```

These fields are defined as follow:

```
        <lst><str name="fq">cataloged_tdt:[NOW/DAY-7DAYS NOW/DAY+1DAY]</str></lst>
        <lst><str name="fq">cataloged_tdt:[NOW/DAY-14DAYS NOW/DAY+1DAY]</str></lst>
        <lst><str name="fq">cataloged_tdt:[NOW/DAY-21DAYS NOW/DAY+1DAY]</str></lst>
        <lst><str name="fq">cataloged_tdt:[NOW/DAY-1MONTH NOW/DAY+1DAY]</str></lst>
        <lst><str name="fq">cataloged_tdt:[NOW/DAY-2MONTHS NOW/DAY+1DAY]</str></lst>
        <lst><str name="fq">cataloged_tdt:[NOW/DAY-3MONTHS NOW/DAY+1DAY]</str></lst>
        <lst><str name="fq">cataloged_tdt:[NOW/DAY-6MONTHS NOW/DAY+1DAY]</str></lst>
```

It seems like Solr expects a `TO` statement between the ranges `cataloged_tdt:[NOW/DAY-6MONTHS TO NOW/DAY+1DAY]`

@hectorcorrea The configs are refreshed manually from the pul_solr repo via this rake task: https://github.com/pulibrary/marc_liberation/blob/alma/lib/tasks/dev.rake#L40

The way to fix this error would probably be to fix it in the [staging config in pul_solr](https://github.com/pulibrary/pul_solr/blob/main/solr_configs/catalog-staging/conf/solrconfig.xml#L156-L162), deploy that config and check that it's good, then fix it in the [production](https://github.com/pulibrary/pul_solr/blob/main/solr_configs/catalog-production/conf/solrconfig.xml#L156-L162) and [production-alt](https://github.com/pulibrary/pul_solr/blob/main/solr_configs/catalog-production-alt/conf/solrconfig.xml#L156-L162) configs in pul_solr and merge all those, then run the rake task above to pull in the fix to lando / circleci here in marc liberation.
